body_content.explanation: for people on a particular kind of Medicare plan for prescription drugs (= ones that can only be bought if a doctor orders them for you), the fact of having to pay for a drug because its cost is between two levels at which the cost will be paid by their plan:
examples: Many seniors fall into the donut hole with Medicare Part D.
To avoid that gap, known as the donut hole, people should look at the brand-name drugs they take and see if there are generic alternatives.

body_content.explanation: a small ball-shaped cake, originally cut out from the middle of a donut (= a small circular cake with a hole cut out of the middle, fried in hot oil):
examples: I just ate about 12 chocolate donut holes.
Don't leave without trying the fried-to-order donut holes.
